Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Pore-filling with strong affinities due to concentrated SiF62- sites

Other Information.Additional Info: High uptake capacity of 41 cm3g-1 at 0.01 bar and 296 K. Maintained strong affinities toward C2H2.
Complete exclusion of larger CH4 molecules; essentially no uptake.
Almost no N2 uptake due to small pore size, excluded even at cryogenic temperature.
Large uptake of 155 cm3g-1 at 1 bar with reversible type I sorption profiles.

Sieving Mechanism: Ideal molecular sieving based on pore aperture, completely excluding larger CH4 molecules while maintaining strong affinity and passage for C2H2.

Experimental Validation.Method: Single-component sorption isotherms (C2H2, CH4, N2, CO2), Ideal Adsorbed Solution Theory (IAST) calculations, Dynamic breakthrough experiments, PXRD
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Record C2H2/CH4 selectivity over 1×107 (IAST); C2H2/CH4 breakthrough separation factor: 52; C2H2 productivity: 73.5 Lkg-1 with 99.5% purity per cycle.

Other Information.Additional Info: Anion-pillared SIFSIX material. Double interpenetrated framework with concentrated SiF62- sites and enriched F atoms. Demonstrates good recyclability and stability over at least five successive cycles. Facile regeneration by purging with helium at 298 K.
Not ideal sieving. C2H2 uptake is less steep at low pressure compared to UTSA-200.
Appreciable CH4 uptake of ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar. Concomitant adsorption with C2H2 observed in breakthrough experiments.

Sieving Mechanism: Adsorption-based separation rather than molecular sieving due to pore size being larger than both guest molecules.

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 sorption isotherms, single-component sorption isotherms (C2H2, CH4), IAST calculations, Experimental breakthrough measurements, PXRD
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C2H2/CH4 selectivity (IAST): 78; CH4 uptake: ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar; C2H2 breakthrough productivity: 49.6 Lkg-1; Breakthrough separation factor: 4.

Other Information.Additional Info: Largest pore size among the SIFSIX materials due to large 4,4'-bipyridine ligand and non-interpenetration.
Not ideal sieving. C2H2 uptake is less steep at low pressure compared to UTSA-200.
Appreciable CH4 uptake of ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar. Concomitant adsorption with C2H2 observed in breakthrough experiments.

Sieving Mechanism: Adsorption-based separation rather than molecular sieving due to pore size being larger than both guest molecules.

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 sorption isotherms, single-component sorption isotherms (C2H2, CH4), IAST calculations, Experimental breakthrough measurements, PXRD
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C2H2/CH4 selectivity (IAST): 124; CH4 uptake: ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar; C2H2 breakthrough productivity: 38.2 Lkg-1; Breakthrough separation factor: 5.

Other Information.Additional Info: Exhibits significantly narrower pore sizes compared to SIFSIX-1-Cu due to interpenetrating structure.
Not ideal sieving. C2H2 uptake is less steep at low pressure compared to UTSA-200.
Appreciable CH4 uptake of ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar. Concomitant adsorption with C2H2 observed in breakthrough experiments.

Sieving Mechanism: Adsorption-based separation rather than molecular sieving due to pore size being larger than both guest molecules.

Experimental Validation.Method: N2 sorption isotherms, single-component sorption isotherms (C2H2, CH4), IAST calculations, Experimental breakthrough measurements, PXRD
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: C2H2/CH4 selectivity (IAST): 85; CH4 uptake: ~10 cm3g-1 at 1 bar; C2H2 breakthrough productivity: 32.4 Lkg-1; Breakthrough separation factor: 4.6.

Other Information.Additional Info: Exhibits significantly narrower pore sizes compared to SIFSIX-1-Cu due to shorter ligand.
